Operation 'post-createPermit' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description is too brief and lacks clarity about inputs, outputs, and effects. It doesn't explain what restrictions can be defined, what the operation returns, or how the permit is used afterward. Added details about request parameters, response structure, and the permit's role in recurring transactions for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Create new permits linked to a recurring contract.
data.current_description: Create permits for a recurring contract, including support for defining restrictions.
data.description_suggestion: Creates new permits linked to a recurring contract with optional restriction definitions. Accepts permit details and restriction parameters in the request. Returns a CreatePermitResult containing the permit reference and confirmation status. The created permit can be used for subsequent recurring transactions with the specified restrictions applied.
data.reasoning: The current description is too brief and lacks clarity about inputs, outputs, and effects. It doesn't explain what restrictions can be defined, what the operation returns, or how the permit is used afterward. Added details about request parameters, response structure, and the permit's role in recurring transactions for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'post-disablePermit' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Current description is incomplete. It doesn't specify what input is required (which reference to provide), what the operation returns, or the effect of disabling a permit. Added clarity about required inputs, response structure, and the consequence of the action for AI agents to better understand when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: Disable a permit that was previously linked to a recurringDetailReference.
data.description_suggestion: Disables an existing permit that was previously linked to a recurringDetailReference. Requires the permit reference or recurringDetailReference in the request. Returns a DisablePermitResult confirming the permit has been disabled. Once disabled, the permit cannot be used for future recurring transactions.
data.reasoning: Current description is incomplete. It doesn't specify what input is required (which reference to provide), what the operation returns, or the effect of disabling a permit. Added clarity about required inputs, response structure, and the consequence of the action for AI agents to better understand when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'post-notifyShopper' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Current description lacks input and output details. It doesn't specify what parameters are required or what the operation returns. Added clarity about required inputs (shopper and payment details), response structure, and regulatory context (Indian payment requirements) to help AI agents understand the operation's scope and applicability.

data.current_summary: Ask issuer to notify the shopper
data.current_description: Sends a request to the issuer so they can inform the shopper about the upcoming recurring payment. This endpoint is used only for local acquiring in India. For more information, refer to [Recurring card payments in India](https://docs.adyen.com/payment-methods/cards/cards-recurring-india).
data.description_suggestion: Sends a request to the card issuer to notify the shopper about an upcoming recurring payment. This operation is specific to local acquiring in India and requires shopper and payment details in the request. Returns a NotifyShopperResult with notification status and confirmation details. Used to ensure shopper awareness of recurring transactions as per Indian payment regulations.
data.reasoning: Current description lacks input and output details. It doesn't specify what parameters are required or what the operation returns. Added clarity about required inputs (shopper and payment details), response structure, and regulatory context (Indian payment requirements) to help AI agents understand the operation's scope and applicability.

message: Operation 'post-scheduleAccountUpdater' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description only explains input options but lacks clarity about the operation's purpose, what it returns, and what happens after scheduling. The description reads more like parameter documentation than an operation description. Added context about the Account Updater's purpose (refresh payment details), response structure, and the side effect (automatic refresh on scheduled date) for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
When making the API call, you can submit either the credit card information, or the recurring detail reference and the shopper reference:
 * If the card information is provided, all the sub-fields for `card` are mandatory.
 * If the recurring detail reference is provided, the fields for `shopperReference` and `selectedRecurringDetailReference` are mandatory.
data.description_suggestion: Schedules the Account Updater to refresh stored payment details. Accepts either full card information (with all card sub-fields required) or a recurring detail reference with shopper reference. Returns a ScheduleAccountUpdaterResult with the update schedule confirmation and status. The Account Updater will automatically refresh the stored payment method details on the scheduled date.
data.reasoning: Current description only explains input options but lacks clarity about the operation's purpose, what it returns, and what happens after scheduling. The description reads more like parameter documentation than an operation description. Added context about the Account Updater's purpose (refresh payment details), response structure, and the side effect (automatic refresh on scheduled date) for better AI agent understanding.
